snippet: Remarks from 1990 in a new book about Ben Bradlee, the former editor of The Washington Post, drew a defense from the reporter Bob Woodward.
abstract: Jeff Himmelman releases authorized biography of Ben Bradlee, the former editor of The Washington Post, entitled Yours in Truth; book includes 1990 quote by Bradlee questioning details in reporter Bob Woodward's account of the Watergate scandal; Woodward responds by noting that Bradlee's comments, which were made long before the identity of his anonymous source was revealed, are outdated. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: It might say something about the state of politics that the biggest story in Washington on Monday happened 40 years ago. And it involves a potted plant. In a new authorized biography of the journalism legend Ben Bradlee, ''Yours in Truth,'' by Jeff Himmelman, Mr. Bradlee is quoted expressing some anxiety over some of the most provocative and enduring details of ''All the President's Men,'' the famous unfurling of the Watergate scandal by Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein.

headline.main: Biography of Editor Keeps the Watergate Twists Coming
